descript.abstract: Electric Power Plants is a point theme representing electric power plants worldwide. Attribute information includes the name of the location, the amount of power that is produced the type of electricity production and the year operation began.
descript.purpose: For educational, non-commercial purposes. This dataset is appropriate for use in a GIS.
descript.supplinf: Electric power generation is the leading type of power generation in the world as a whole. Electric power plants are major enterprises and are the most significant elements of electric power generation. They provide the economy with electric power and, in some cases, heating power. Power plants are classified according to the primary sources of energy used for power generation. The present-day power industry is based on thermoelectric, hydroelectric, and nuclear power, and these are the types shown on the maps in this atlas. Thermoelectricity is produced using the energy released by burning mineral and organic fuel. Hydroelectricity is generated by converting the mechanical energy of water flow into electricity by turning an electric generator shaft with hydraulic turbines. Nuclear electricity is produced by converting the heat generated in a nuclear reactor to steam, which turns a turbo-generator shaft. Other types of power plants are located sporadically. They use solar, wind, geothermal, and tidal energy. Power plants in the economically well-developed countries are combined into automatically and centrally controlled electric power systems. They provide electric power for various kinds of consumers.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.1850

procstep.procdesc:
The data on electric power plants was compiled by the list of electric power stations made in the cartographic enterprise "Kartografiya" of the Federal Service of Russia for Geodesy and Cartography. It was revised and complemented by national maps and atlases and textual and reference materials. The database contains information about the name, capacity, country, and geographical coordinates (determined using large-scale maps) of each thermoelectric, hydroelectric, and nuclear power plant.
World, national, and regional atlases and maps of various countries were used to compile and verify the information on electric power plants.
Datasets for each continent were converted from ESRI coverage to the ESRI shapefile format using the 'copy features' tool and merged into one layer using the 'merge' tool.

cntperp.cntorg: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The type of electricity production station
The amount of energy produced in thousands of killowatt-hours
The year operation began, where this information was available.
The name of the place where the station is located
Code for any diacritical marks in the name
